vulkan10core.name: robustBufferAccess
vulkan10core.comment: widely supported but has performance overhead, so remains an optional feature to enable

groupComment: [REQUIRE] Roadmap 2022 requires support for these, device support is ubiquitous and enablement is unlikely to harm performance
I have no clue if these cause overheads from simply being enabled

vulkan10core.name: logicOp
vulkan10core.comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] somewhat legacy features

groupComment: [REQUIRE] Roadmap 2022 requires support for these, device support is ubiquitous and enablement is unlikely to harm performance

vulkan10core.name: depthBounds
vulkan10core.comment: this is kinda like a weird clip-plane that doesn't count towards clip plane count

vulkan10core.name: wideLines
vulkan10core.comment: good device support, but a somewhat useless feature (constant screenspace width with limits on width)

vulkan10core.name: largePoints
vulkan10core.comment: good device support, but a somewhat useless feature (axis aligned screenspace boxes with limits on size)

vulkan10core.name: samplerAnisotropy
vulkan10core.comment: [REQUIRE] Roadmap 2022 requires support for these, device support is ubiquitous

groupComment: [DO NOT EXPOSE] these 3 don't make a difference, just shortcut from Querying support from PhysicalDevice
[EXPOSE AS LIMIT] Enabled by Default, Moved to Limits

vulkan10core.name: shaderStorageImageMultisample
vulkan10core.comment: [EXPOSE AS LIMIT] Cannot be always enabled cause Intel ARC is handicapped

groupComment: TODO: format feature reporting unimplemented yet for both of the below! (should we move to usage reporting?)
[EXPOSE AS LIMIT] always enable, shouldn't cause overhead by just being enabled

vulkan10core.name: shaderStorageImageArrayDynamicIndexing
vulkan10core.comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] ROADMAP 2022 but Apple GPUs have poor support

vulkan10core.name: shaderFloat64
vulkan10core.comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] Cannot be always enabled cause Intel ARC is handicapped

groupComment: [TODO LATER] once we implemented sparse resources

vulkan10core.name: variableMultisampleRate
vulkan10core.comment: [EXPOSE AS LIMIT] poor support on Apple GPUs

groupComment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] Enabled by Default, Moved to Limits : ALIAS VK_KHR_16bit_storage

vulkan11core.name: multiview
vulkan11core.comment: [REQUIRE] Required to be present when Vulkan 1.1 is supported

groupComment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] VK_KHR_multiview required but these depend on pipelines and MoltenVK mismatches these
[REQUIRE] Will eventually be required by HLSL202x if it implements references or pointers (even the non-generic type)
[DO NOT EXPOSE] not gonna expose until we have a need to
or via VkPhysicalDeviceProtectedMemoryProperties provided by Vulkan 1.1

vulkan11core.name: samplerYcbcrConversion
vulkan11core.comment: [DO NOT EXPOSE] ROADMAP 2022 Enables certain formats in Vulkan, we just enable them if available or else we need to make format support query functions in LogicalDevice as well

groupComment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] ROADMAP 2022 requires support but MoltenVK doesn't support, exposed as a limit `drawIndirectCount`

vulkan12core.name: storagePushConstant8
vulkan12core.comment: [EXPOSE AS LIMIT] not great support yet

groupComment: [EXPOSE AS LIMIT] ROADMAP 2024 but not great support yet

vulkan12core.name: shaderInputAttachmentArrayDynamicIndexing
vulkan12core.comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] This is for a SPIR-V capability, the overhead should only be incurred if the pipeline uses this capability

vulkan12core.name: shaderUniformBufferArrayNonUniformIndexing
vulkan12core.comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] ROADMAP 2022 mandates but poor device support

vulkan12core.name: shaderInputAttachmentArrayNonUniformIndexing
vulkan12core.comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] This is for a SPIR-V capability, the overhead should only be incurred if the pipeline uses this capability

groupComment: We have special bits on the Descriptor Layout Bindings and those should decide the overhead, not the enablement of a feature like the following
[EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] not great coverage but still can enable when available
[REQUIRE] Roadmap 2022 requires support for these we always enable and they're unlikely to harm performance
[DO NOT EXPOSE] Decided against exposing, API is braindead, for details see: https://github.com/Devsh-Graphics-Programming/Nabla/issues/378
[DO NOT EXPOSE] for capture tools not engines

vulkan12core.groupComment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] ROADMAP2022 wants them, but device support low

groupComment: This feature adds stricter requirements for how out of bounds reads from images are handled.
most out of bounds reads return R, G, and B values of zero and alpha values of either zero or one.
Components not present in the image format may be set to zero
or to values based on the format as described in Conversion to RGBA in vulkan specification.
widely supported but has performance overhead, so remains an optional feature to enable
[DO NOT EXPOSE] VK_EXT_inline_uniform_block EVIL regressive step back into OpenGL/Dx10 times? Or an intermediate step between PC and UBO?

[EXPOSE AS LIMIT] Vulkan 1.3 non-optional requires but poor support
[REQUIRE] Nabla Core Profile, Vulkan 1.3 or VK_EXT_subgroup_size_control
[DO NOT EXPOSE] Doesn't make a difference, just shortcut from Querying support from PhysicalDevice
[EXPOSE AS LIMIT] Vulkan 1.3 non-optional requires but poor support
[REQUIRE] Vulkan 1.3 non-optional requires, you probably want to look at the individual limits anyway
